title: Had to give permission like 7 times
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2017
content: 1) Launch the app to give permission2) Are you sure you want to give permissions?3) All of your children listed here will have access, are you still sure?4) Alright then, enter your password to give permission.5) Now enter the code sent to your phone to give permission.6) Great now press OK to give permission again!7) I've sent you an email confirming you've given permission.At this point, I'm pretty sure it's easier to give permission for a nuclear launch than it is to open this app... Now that we're in, the app seems kinda fun, but now I'm worried about what exactly I've given permission for. If takes 7 steps to confirm, there must have been some malicious fine print... I'll play the game, then disable the skill, just in case.Update: kids loved the game, so giving it an extra star.

title: Oh What Fun it is to hear Santa!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2021
content: When I received an email that there was a Hey Santa personality for our Echo dots I was amused and just had to try it.  Love it!  I have a 4th generation dot in the living room and a 3rd generation echo show in the kitchen, both Hey Santa enabled.  We are all adults here in the household but Santa is fun to communicate with for sure.  I've read the other reviews and just have to shake my head at the people who probably have the older version of the Echo and are ranting because the Hey Santa doesn't work on their dots, they really need to take up reading and see that there is a notation that the personality doesn't work on some devices.  Anyway I am looking forward to Santa sharing some Christmas songs and chatter later today.

title: Great stories and music for Christmas
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021

Santa sounds great and is pretty funny. My family really loves that he tells them stories, especially the ones about holiday traditions around the world and some fun food things. They keep asking for more and more. It's a nice Christmas freebie for sure!

title: Looks like something written during an Amazon Developer Day
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2015
content: Another Amazonian cranking out a skill.Ease of Use: 3 out of 5. In the past I've given full marks to trivial interfaces. I'm changing my mind now. There isn't really anything to this interface, therefore there wasn't actually any design in it. So from this skill forward I'm only giving trivial interfaces neutral marks.Ironically, this will pull this skill up.Usefulness: 1 out of 5. This does exactly what it says. It takes a name, and mangles it in some child's rhyme. The problem is that the pacing is off, much like when it reads Knock-Knock jokes (which is why my skill breaks it up!) The most fun I had with this was trying to tick Alexa into saying dirty words.Novelty: 2 out of 5. OK, so no one has done a word mangling skill before. I'm not really sure this is a bad thing. Maybe translating into pig latin is next.Overall: 1 out of 5. This looks and plays like something someone thought of and wrote during an Amazon Developer Day. It took almost no effort to do, and really doesn't achieve much.

content: I guess if you want Alexa to randomly assign chores to a list of people this would work for you. I was looking for Alexa to keep track of whose turn it actually IS to do something among my 3 kids, so it being random doesn‚Äôt work for us. I just don‚Äôt want the kids arguing every day about whose turn it is to do a specific chore (we rotate) so wish I could set up a chore rota and Alexa could keep track. This doesn‚Äôt seem to do this...and there are no instructions anywhere so I have no idea how it works or how to set it up.

title: Doesn't work
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2018
content: I was able to add helpers for the question "Whose turn is it to do the dishes". From there on, it is a crapshoot to figure out what Alexa will do. Some of the time it picks a random name from the helpers list (where can I make this a recurrent weekly list for each helper??), another time "Sorry, I'm not sure". The next time "Table wear are dishes, ‚Ä¶" then goes on some random rant about completely useless information about the restaurant industry. Then "Hmmm, I don't know that one". Really?? And I got an email today from Amazon touting the benefits of the "Whose turn" app. Shouldn't you guys make sure it works before mass-emailing your customers about an app (with a great potential) that does not work?

I just got a message back saying that that name was not on my list. it's also really annoying that I have to tell Alexa to open it before I can use it. Several lenovo devices that were sold with built-in Alexa have had all of the best features stripped away with each update thanks to Amazon's greed.Purchased specifically to use with ring doorbells and cameras, within a few months forced updates removed and blocked this and many of the better capabilities, reducing the built-in Alexa to a to a basic, near useless device.  What a joke and disappointment, This mammoth billionaire dupes and manipulates their customers and 3rd party vendors. No customer loyalty.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Amazon promised us Celebrity Voices on our Echo, what they gave us is a poor skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
content: Amazon marketed this as a way to replace Alexa's voice with Samuel L Jackson's. What you get is a skill for Alexa that makes you sound like someone who is mad at someone in the same room. Example, "Alexa, Ask Sam what the weather is like". Then you get a Samuel L Jackson Response, He doesn't answer everything, and otherwise you're stuck with Alexa. I wanted a customized voice for my assistant full time, not a quirky skill that says curse words every now and again. Worst waste of a dollar i've ever spent.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: So disappointed
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
content: OK, I read the description but was sure there had to be more to this, so I purchased it.  There isn't. You have to ask Alexa to ask Samuel everything. I was under the impression I could have Alexa speak to me in Samuel's voice rather than the female voice we currently have. Nope, only if I ask Alexa to ask Samuel. Who wants to add more steps than you already have to take to get a response. I don't get it. For free, maybe try it, but not purchase.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: "Alexa, ask Sam"??? @#%$#$^# PLEASE!!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
content: No, it's gotta be either "Alexa, what's the weather," and Sam just answers, or the wake word needs to be "Sam Jackson".  What's wrong with "Sam Jackson, what's the weather"?  "It's @#$@#$ COLD outside, mutha#@#$@#$!!!!!"  Asking Alexa to ASK Sam is just weak.  Was about to buy until I saw this.  Boooo.  Fix it Amazon!

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Poor concept. Poor implementation. Useless party trick.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
content: I'm not sure who at Amazon decided this was a good idea. It's not even worth a dollar. The implementation of a voice as a skill limits what the voice can do and means you have to use a completely unnatural syntax in order to interact with the voice. If Amazon is going to implement celebrity voices, they need to become the default voice for the unit.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa

Some words are spelled with natural Cadence and letter blending.Ask Sam to spell, "Pretty"  95% natural sounding.  The sound of the R is cutoff but the other letters are perfect.Ask Sam to Spell, "PussyCat" 60% natural sounding. The sound of the Y is garbled the other letters are perfect.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: No clue what others are complaining about

content: You don't have to ask Alexa to ask Samuel for anything. At least not anything that I needed so far. As far as I can tell this IS a full voice replacement for Alexa.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Best m*&^%r#$@%&n' 99 cents I've ever spent!!! Love it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
content: I'll be honest, my Alexa stays pretty simple. I ask the weather. I put on thunderstorm sounds to read by. I enjoy Amazon Music Unlimited while I'm cooking in the kitchen. But THIS... this has jazzed up my Echo Show quite a bit.I started out by asking Sam for the weather, and he started out with "Lemme look out the window and see..." then he told me the weather for my specific little town, *by name*, and - just as Alexa does, asked me did I want the extended forecast. The whole thing was *seamless*. Literally like the venerable Mr. Jackson is hanging out right there in your Echo, waiting to assist. (Lol.)When you first open the app, Alexa offers you the choice of the censored or uncensored version. I applaud that. Use Sam responsibly, folks. Me, I'm a single guy with a somewhat naive Pomeranian, so I opted for the uncensored version.Since then, he's told me jokes, and I've explored other fun features. Just a fantastic skill. If you like his work, by all means, get it right f*&^%n' now. (Note: I've yet to actually hear any *real* profanity from this skill, I don't want to give you the wrong impression.)PS - Mr. Jackson, I just hope you see this - I want you to know I can tell you worked *hard* on this! Lots of thanks and praise for your work here!Now, Amazon... let's get moving with that Morgan Freeman voice skill!

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Don't waste your time.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
content: So first off at this point (12/18/19) this is a skill and you have to ask alexa to ask Sam whatever you want it to do which is just adding extra steps to something that should in my opinion be just a swap out of Alexas normal voice. Thus meaning you use it like 3 times then get tired of it and never use it again. He wont say any explicit words and even said his favorite word was "love".... knowing dang well his favorite word ,and the one he's most well known for, rhymes with mothertrucker. This would be OK at best if it was free (yea it's only a buck but still). If they do it as an actual replacement for the original alexa voice it would be awesome, but also as is I'll never use it again which means it was a 100% waste at this point. I was really excited for this but yet again developers let us down. Maybe they will do the right thing and take it back to the drawing board due to the overwhelming bad reviews but I doubt it because they don't listen to their patrons.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa

content: I like the explicit version. Gives alexa a great twist.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Hey Samuel Works For Me
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
content: HE RECITES EZEKIEL 25 17!! They must have updated it because he does most things i need like weather, asking questions, settings timers, and setting alarms. When he can't do something, he calls Alexa in. I asked him about a Royale with Cheese but he didn't know.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Worthless Scam.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
content: If you think for a second that this is going to be an amusing Samuel L. Jackson you are mistaken.  I couldn't wait to hear Sam YELLING obscenity laden responses at me, only to find that what you actually get is the most toned down boring Samuel you will ever hear.  This is what you would get if you gave the real Samuel a lobotomy.  In desperation I asked Sam to say something explicit, knowing that I had enabled explicit responses in the Alexa App.  His only response is something about the versatility of the F word.  Ask again and you get the same response.  Ask Sam for a joke and you only get the usual Alexa jokes, which are worse than any Dad jokes ever conceived.  I was looking forward to making my family laugh with this, but it's not even novel enough to bother mentioning to them.  It will never get used.Though it might be unfunny, it might actually be a little useful if you could change Alexa's voice and perhaps even the trigger word to Sam...but no.  It's just a skill that requires you to invoke it using a command."Alexa, ask Sam to...".Amazon you really disappointed me on this.  I'm so tempted to demand a refund, but I know it would be a tedious waste of time for 99 cents.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Doesn't seem to work
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2020
content: Update: After a week, the voice just started working. Assuming Amazon did something on their end to fix the issue many people are having.  Now that it works, I am pleased with the 99 cents it cost.  Not a whole lot of explicit content, but Jackson's voice is a nice change from Alexa's.-------I was able to enable Mr. Jackson a day ago, but whenever I say "Hey Samuel", Alexa answers "Sorry, I'm having trouble. Please try in a little while".  I have the 2nd generation dot, but it doesn't work on my Echo Show or my Echo Flex either.  Exact same message.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Fun, but not a must have
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
content: For the introductory price, this is one of those cheap thrills you can get to have a little fun with Alexa. Right now I'm waiting for my husband to get home so I can make Sam say something to surprise him. For me, the explicit version was the way to go, but if you like it squeaky clean you can set it that way as well. So you can still have Nick Fury's voice on this if you have little kids around at your house.He can read you the weather forecast and some other stuff like that. You can give Sam commands in ways like "Alexa, ask Sam to turn on light." And Sam will say "OK," and turn on the light. So he doesn't replace Alexa, and the commands get a little more cumbersome. You're not going to say that stuff all the time, especially at the end of the day when you want to just turn everything off and get to bed.This is more for playing around with friends rather than every day things. It's a novelty, not a must-have. I would recommend it for Marvel fans, and fans of Samuel L. Jackson or people who are really into movies he's been in. Three and a half stars.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Not as it seems.. You have to say " Alexa ask Sam"...and its not baked in (automatic)
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
content: For the initial 99 cents, Ill use it, but after the 99 cent trial month is over I will not be renewing this skill for $5 a Month!. You have to say " Alexa ask Sam, or Alexa Ask Sam Jackson"...then ask your question such as what is the weather....etc The Alexa App has a specific section within the settings for celebrity Voice, and I expected once I clicked on Samuel L Jackson that the voice would now be Alexa's new Default voice without having to ask Alexa to ask another Skill to tell me the weather. If this was a free skill I would not complain, but they are going to be asking $5 a month for this! They made it appear by the videos and advertising for this that it was a baked in skill from Amazon, but it is not. Its the same as if you had any third party skill that you wanted to use, where you have to ask alexa to ask that skill to then as your question. NOT WORTH IT.  I should be able to just say " Alexa what's the weather?" and since I have the celebrity voice enabled IN ALEXA'S SETTINGS Sam Jackson should automatically respond. So this is just to let everyone know, don't get me wrong yes its cool, but not worth what they will be charging after the first month of .99 cents. it is NOT worth the $5 they will be charging a month after. If this is evolved into a more intuitive baked in feature like they made it seem to be, I would consider it, but I don't need to add yet ANOTHER step / command in order to use a skill that should be baked in and automatically "take over" alexa's voice. otherwise what is the point of having the "Celebrity Voice" option with in the Response Settings in the Alexa App?!.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Whats the point?
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
content: I was looking forward to having SLJ  bad mouth me and add a little spice to the typical Alexa responses but its all just the same.  And that's when Alexa doesn't decide to answer for me even though I used the "Hey Samuel" awake word.  Disappointing.  Every response should be of SLJ, not just some.  And it really shouldn't matter which awake word i use, the chosen voice is all that should matter.  Thats how google works and thats how i expected this to work.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: It‚Äôll Surprise You
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
content: So funny story: I bought this the day it came out. Installed easily. Made sure the ‚Äòexplicit‚Äô option was activated. Wife and I tried about 50 different commands to get him to curse. He would not do it. Asked him the weather, he‚Äôd cheerfully respond. Asked him his favorite word, it‚Äôs ‚Äúlove‚Äù. So I was kinda disappointed.Fast forward a couple days and we‚Äôre hosting our family Christmas party. Ages range from 10 to 81 (grandparents being very conservative). We‚Äôre halfway through the party and everyone‚Äôs in the living room. I try showing off the Sam Jackson voice and ask him ‚ÄúAlexa, ask Sam Jackson the weather‚Äù.  Whole room of 25+ people quiet enough to hear ‚ÄúI‚ÄôM NOT GONNA TELL YOU THE MOTHERF‚Äî-ING WEATHER!‚Äù Whole room goes silent and everyone looks at me. It was pretty mortifying but hilarious in hindsight. Half the family later told me it was their favorite part of the party.It‚Äôs fun. And worth the $.99

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Why can't I just say, "Sam"....?
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2021
content: I thought this was going to be a REPLACEMENT voice for "Alexa". A name and more enjoyable voice that will be the wake up word for Echo, for me to ask questions, that will be ANSWERED, KNOWLEDGABLY, by Mr. Jackson's voice. What it is, however, is a name/voice where I have to say, "Hey Samuel", fully every time, instead of just "Hey Sam", "Samuel", or more simply, just "Sam", (if Mr. Jackson prefers his voice to be addressed as "Samuel" as opposed to the shorter version, "Sam", I can respect THAT preference, or EVEN saying, "Mr. Jackson". It's just too much with the "hey" having to be said, as well as "Samuel"). Especially considering that I only had to say, "Alexa" as the wake up word, before this voice was offered to me.Not only that, but the "Hey Samuel" voice is VERY limited in what "Hey Samuel" can actually answer or say. I know, I know, the limitations were explained before purchase. Still, I was expecting more than THIS.Most times the "Alexa" voice cuts in and answers for "Hey Samuel". While the "Hey Samuel" voice will say, "I don't have an answer for that". Also, in answering questions, not only does "Alexa" voice cut off the "Hey Samuel" voice that I initiated the wake up with, sometimes, the "Hey Samuel" voice will cut off his OWN "Hey Samuel" voice or my question, by saying WHAT I SHOULD be asking the "Hey Samuel" voice, BEFORE I even ask a question. These actions are quite irritating.Also, the "Hey Samuel" voice jokes are VERY lame. Not really jokes, at all.Amazon, please give The People a REAL CHOICE of ENTIRELY REPLACING the "Alexa" voice with the celebrity voice, or whatever voice, of THEIR OWN choosing? Maybe you can give more choices to choose from? And make the wake up word short & simple, like "SAM" or as I mentioned, the other above choices for Samuel L. Jackson. Or whoever.It's not that I don't like or appreciate the "Alexa" voice, I was just prepared for a complete change from the same voice I have been hearing for about 4 years now.I do LIKE the Samuel L. Jackson voice. I just believe how it responds can be much improved on.Thank you,G. Townsend

title: Does not work on Fire Stick, but will let you purchase anyway

content: I had heard about this service and was excited to get it. I spoke to my Fire Stick "Alexa, talk like Samuel L Jackson" I got a phrase back and I was asked if I would like to purchase this feature. It was only 99 cents. I agreed and it was activated after I was warned about explicit content.Samuel then came on and said "When you want me to talk, say 'Alexa, ask Samuel'"However, when I say that, Alexa does a search and finds a commentary on the book of Samuel. When I specifically say "Hey, Samuel" Alexa tells me that she is having trouble and I should try again later.After an internet search f how to get Samuel to talk, I tried another phrase. Samuel then spoke up to say, "Sorry, this service is not available on your device."WHY was I allowed to purchase it on a device that it doesn't even work on? Or at the very least, it should have said what its restrictions were. Now I have to go to the trouble to try to get a refund.I love my Fire Stick, but it should not be able to purchase services that it cannot perform.

content: While its a neat novelty to show friends when they visit... the fact that you have to specifically ask Alexa to ask Sam to do something gets old really fast. The number of things that he can do is fairly limited, essentially just replacing Alexa's voice reply to weather, music requests, joke telling, etc. But its not a direct replacement, so again you have to ask her to ask Sam to tell you the weather. Ask her to ask Sam to tell you a joke, etc. So instead of saying "Alexa tell me the weather" you have to say "Alexa, tell Sam to tell me the weather." While he does occasionally drop profanities, they are few and far between and when they are weather related they sound out of context because voice infliction and tone are off. I mean this is Samuel L. Jackson... where is the "D$%# , its cold out Mo$^&% @@#%%^^!"? If amazon really wants to make celebrity voice overs a marketable add on skill, they need to make it a replacement for the default voice like Tom Tom did with the GPS.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Not ready.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
content: I will start by saying what I like about this: Samuel L. Jackson. I am sure that most purchased this voice for that same reason, and their expectations were dashed aside with the reality of this skill.At the time of this writing, the skill is an underdeveloped mess, not meeting the basic expectations of any buyer as shown by reviews you will certainly see. It needs the following improvements to merit a more solid 3-4 star rating:1) Full Alexa integration. Though it may not have been advertised, this voice should be able to nearly fully replace Alexa's standard voice, or at least respond to the extent of its programming with more simpler context like "Sam" or whatever one might set it to. It is otherwise at least a little misleading, as others have said.2) More appropriate utilization of Sam Jackson's voice. Whether it was poor coding or not, his voice is not natural and not prepared to be delivered as a product as it has been.3) Functionality should match expectations. When you select "mature content allowed," you certainly should expect the content which is delivered to you to merit that rating. In my usage of this skill, I rarely come across a single explicit word, which promptly defeats the premise of having Sam Jackson as an Alexa skill. Developers, do you know who Sam Jackson is? When we download this skill, activate it, enable explicit mode and demo it with a smile and excitement for the first time, how sincerely you have let us down when he responds in his abnormally robotic tone, simply, with the weather. "Today it is cloudy." This is self explanatory and unsatisfactory.In conclusion, much like my first trip to China from the USA back in 2013, this is very "under construction," though I have no confidence that the developers intend to continue updating or producing for this product. I cannot imagine anyone paying 5$ for it, and am happy that I only had to pay 0.99$. Sorry to see such a waste of potential humor and entertainment.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Disappointing
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
content: The concept is exquisite, but the execution is severely lacking.  I was hoping that Samuel L. Jackson would become the default voice of my Alexa devices, lending his iconic badassery to every interaction.  In reality, you have to phrase your initial prompts in a clunky manner, i.e. "Alexa, ask Samuel L. Jackson to tell me the weather."  The number of things that Sam can say and do are conspicuously limited.  In most cases, Sam's robotic voice sounds stilted and highly un-Samuel-L-Jacksonlike, especially when he replies, "No one knows the answer to that."  All in all, though, I get that it's just a buck - and accordingly, it's ample entertainment for a good ten minutes.  But let's face it; it's a wasted opportunity. This could be so much better, on every level.  I believe that if Amazon gets it right over time, they will have an epic hit on their hands.

title: READ the print and check your devices before you buy, I didn't :(  ... Wake Word disappointment
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
content: READ the print, I didn't .... so I have to use ‚ÄúAlexa, ask Samuel‚Äù on all my devices due to their age or type, ‚ÄúHey Samuel‚Äù doesn't work on my devices.  The print that didn't register to me until after the purchase [ The ‚ÄúHey Samuel‚Äù wake word works FOR MOST Voice-Activated Echo devices in your home, EXCEPT First-Generation Echo and ECHO DOT and ECHO LOOK. Users without a compatible device can use ‚ÄúAlexa, ask Samuel‚Äù. ] I'm a longtime user of Alexa / Echo Devices, from the beginning. Though I have a number of devices, they are all older or the wrong type (such as Echo Dots) so "Hey Samuel" just doesn't work. So the user experience just isn't as natural once your use to just saying Alexa or ECHO. (I have my devices respond to different wake words, so why can't they just add Samuel to the list?) ... Hey Amazon, you created and revolutionized the term "The Customer Experience".  How about writing a few more lines of code to improve this potentially great feature for us users by including the wake word Samuel? ... great idea but poor execution for now.  AND Samuel Jackson is great but don't stop there,  signing-up more great voices from people like Morgan Freeman or James Earl Jones, even Yoda would be great, I could see using a voice per day or a random mix or different parts of the day, etc. At $5 per voice that should be an enticing opportunity and you can offer us package deals.

He will then proceed to ask you if you are ok with the vulgarity in his speaking. It is a quick 2 minute or less process. The skill was automatically turned on when I purchased it. Therefore, there is no need to go into the app to turn it on. Unless, of course, if you experience a problem and for some reason it didn‚Äôt automatically do this for you. I only have him installed on one device in my office since I have children lol. Fun Fact: Did you know Samuel Jackson actually had a stutter from childhood which caused him to use ‚ÄúMF‚Äôer‚Äù in order to get his speaking back on track?

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Good Idea, Flawed Execution
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
content: I initially viewed this skill as a solution to a problem I have with two Alexa devices that're in very close proximity to one another and need to share a wake word only some of the time. It's nice having "Hey, Samuel" only work on devices you specifically activate it on.That's probably where the positives end.Samuel does a decent job of explaining how to customize the skill. Unfortunately, the settings are buried further in the app than I'd like, and it'd be nice if you could access some of them with voice commands.For example, I figured I made a mistake by allowing Samuel to use profanity, as he just had something to say after every single command I'd give him. I asked him to turn profanity off, and he turned on a filter that prevented explicit music from playing. Why? Even worse, I couldn't turn that filter off with a voice command, so I had to find that separate setting before digging around to figure out how to disable Samuel's profanity.Unfortunately, disabling his profanity just made him not swear during the extra statements. Stop making these assistants so talkative.Anyway, getting back to the wake word workaround, I mostly want two devices to potentially respond to the same commands, but I always want alarms on my Echo Plus, as my Fire TV Cube isn't nearly as loud and may end up trying to play alarm sounds through my TV speaker, despite not being on that TV input. So, I figured I'd use Samuel to set alarms more easily on my Echo Plus by only using Samuel on my Echo Plus.At no point does Samuel warn you that his alarms don't use your usual alarm sound. Nah, it's Samuel L. Jackson, yelling at you to wake up. Here's the thing: I live alone. I'm used to waking up with no one else in my apartment, and I'm certainly NOT used to being yelled at by anyone to wake up. If anything, in the rare case that I sleep in, maybe someone calls me. Imagine the brief moment of panic as I'm woken up by Samuel L. Jackson yelling at me. It certainly woke me up, but man...to say that I was startled is a bit of an understatement.In short, make Samuel less chatty. He doesn't need to say something witty after he acknowledges that he did what you asked him to. And he really needs to give you an option to use your regular alarm sound the first time you ask him to set an alarm (and the first time you ask him to set an alarm once such a fix has been implemented).

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Unbelievable value
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
content: I don't understand the negative reviews.  We are enjoying the heck out of this new feature.  The price point is very reasonable for what you get.  "Hey Samuel" is his wake word, regardless of what the description says, so you don't have to ask Alexa anything other than to turn on the skill.  Samuel will give you your notifications, the weather, information, and he'll swear at you.  It's perfect.  He will politely inform you when he can't do some things, but then will often just hand it off to Alexa.  I hope this is successful, and I hope they add more voices down the road.  Morgan Freeman would be great.  Shatner would be good as well.  All in all, a great value, a lot of fun and gives you options to talk to either Alexa or Samuel.  Well done, whomever came up with the idea.  And thank you Samuel, for doing the project.  A perfect first entry into celebrity voices for the Echo.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: It's cool when it works...but it's clunky
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
content: I have an Alexa device in almost every room in my house, coupled with Phillips Hue lights, Ring doorbell, Nest thermostat and even a smart oil gauge.  It's extremely convenient to turn lights on and off, turn up the heat etc.When I first heard about Samuel L. Jackson being a celebrity voice for Alexa, I knew I was going to pay for it...heck, I would have paid much more than I did to have SLJ talk instead of Alexa's voice...but this implementation falls hard and fast right on its' face.  You'd THINK that you'd be able to change Alexa's voice to use SLJ instead...nope!  What you do get is this:Alexa ASK Samuel what time it is?Alexa ASK Samuel to tell me a joke.Alexa ASK Samuel...Now, this is clunky...it reminds me very much of the smart oil gauge that I have on my oil tank.  I have to say "Alexa, Ask smart oil gauge how much oil is in the tank."  That's poor integration...but what's worse is the majority of the time it doesn't even work.  I'll say "Alexa, ask Samuel what time it is?" and I'll get a response from Alexa saying "It's 5 o clock" or whatever time it is.It's not as though this is really expensive but it's a huge let down...huge huge huge letdown.

title: Maybe I just don't get it
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020
content: Listen, it's undeniably cooler to have SLJ tell me the time and weather than it is Alexa, but it's also more troublesome.  Ready for some real first world problem whining?  Instead of "Alexa what time is it?" I have to say, "Alexa, ask Samuel the time."  Why does that bother me so much?  I don't know, but I'm not kidding, I just don't find it worth it once the novelty wore off.  The very first time I asked him, he responded like, "I'll tell you the m***********g time!" and I was like, "Ha! That Samuel is cool."  But since that one time, he seems as bored by it as I am.  Now he's just like, "The time is six twenty-three a.m."  OK, I'm lying, I NEVER get up that early.Will Samuel do more than the time and weather?  I dunno.  I haven't discovered anything, and I'm just not interested enough to Google it.  Though I guess I'll spend even more time than that would take writing a "meh" review of it.  And so now you're going to post a comment about all the cool stuff he'll do, aren't you?  Thanks.  But I don't hang around Amazon all day looking at comments, bro.  My video games aren't going to level up themselves.  So by the time I see your suggestions, the Singularity will have already happened and Samuel Jackson's disembodied voice is going to be demanding I tell HIM the time.  And boy is he going to be disappointed that I don't even know the weather.Tl;dr?  Yeah, me too.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Updated 1/26/2021 due to positive changes with app
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
content: 1/26/2021 Updated  - i had not used the app as enabled since the first week i installed it due to being so very limited in what it could do at launch. i tried it by chance two days ago and found they had made several changes that made this much better now.example when connected to a wyze cam and ask "hey samuel show me the front yard." now instead of the lame alexa voice the "ok" portion is sam jackson's voice. so now with these changes most voice responses come out as sam jackson when you begin by saying "hey samuel."if for some reason the response is too lengthy or complicated e.g. reminders then you'll get a short response using sam's voice followed by him asking alexa to step in and help out. the transition from one to the other is seamless.also you can completely replace saying alexa now with "hey samuel" not just limited to alert words such as the standard "echo" "alexa" or "computer." that said once you have enabled the samuel voice in settings your device will respond to either "alexa" assuming it's your default in addition to "hey samuel."this now works on every alexa device with one exception, the original 'tall' V1 of the echo does not have this within its settings options. but as for echo units from the original dots, shows, all versions of the echo's with hubs, it's all there now. i would have given it five stars if the voice could have read my reminders out loud but for now i'm very happy with these changes.Original review at launch - i thought this would be kind of cool as a replacement voice for alexa. however the only way i have found to get this to work so far is to say the entire sentence, "alexa ask samuel l jackson what's the weather?" it doesn't work if you just say alexa what's the weather. you still just get standard alexa not samuel jackson? if i could do as intended, hoped and totally replaced alexa's voice with jackson's i'd be happy and give it five stars. with it as it is currently designed i'll very rarely use this if ever. at least it only cost a buck so there's that.if you just want a party trick of sorts you'll like this, especially if you go into settings and enable 'explicit' language. but if you want his voice to replace the stock alexa then this won't do the trick.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: after reading others reviews, works better than I expected
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021
content: Happy with my purchase today 4/27/2021.  Instead of using "Alexa" as the wake word, I use "Hey Samuel".Every response has Samuel L Jacksons (SLJ) voice. Some of the phrases are completely pre recorded (which sound great) and are inserted before Alexa's standard reply's. Like when I ask for the weather, he said: "aright, I'll look outside for you" and continue with the standard "The weather in  _____ is ___ degrees. expect sun...".As expected, people's names and other user specific phrases are a bit stuttered, similar to other computer generated voices, but its still SLJ voice.  Overall, I think its totally worth the couple bucks  to add it to any of my Alexa(s)Note; At any time you can use your regular wake word (alexa, computer, or amazon) to hear the standard alexa voice responses. Its great easter egg for those who are use-to/prefer alexas standard voice.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Coolest thing ever!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
content: Very awesome and totally worth it. I have Echo devices in almost every room of my house. Problem is that sometimes the kitchen device responds when I want the living room one to. So, I got Sam Jackson going in the Living room and my bedroom. Which is great. My Echo Dot still answers to "Alexa". But it also answers to "hey Samuel". And Sam Jackson can do everything that Alexa does. He turns on my lights. He turns off entire rooms.. He turns on & off my TV. He tells me the weather forecast. And if you ask him to tell a joke, he's always got a good one. You can have him be vulgar, or turn that off if you have kids or don't want to hear swers. But if you do like swears, than ask him what his net worth is.. Lol. In fact as him personal questions. He'll answer. And don't even get him started on snakes on a plane.. Lol. I highly recommend this. No longer have to say Alexa & Sam Jackson makes everything sound cooler. Even if he's just saying "okay" after you ask him to shut a light off.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Not quite what I thought it would be
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
content: First, let me say that because I only paid 99 cents for this feature, I do consider it a value. After all, it's Samuel L. Jackson. Is it easy to use? Sure. It's almost the same as using Alexa. The problem is, that I have to ask Alexa to ask Sam. That's not only ridiculous, but a waste of time and talking. I should be able to *switch* to SLJ's voice and speak directly, not ask Alexa to ask Sam. That's totally lame.So, it is easy to use, just a bit inefficient with the extra step of having to ask Alexa to ask. I consider it a value, because I only paid 99 cents. The integration is not good because of the extra step.So, bottom line, am I sorry I bought this? Not really. It was only 99 cents and I like having SLJ's voice respond.Will I buy any other voices in the future? No. Not unless they change the interaction and I can speak directly without having to ask Alexa first.I gave it three stars because it's a clever idea. In theory, I would give it a 5 just for SLJ's voice, but then Amazon wouldn't know that it's not what it could be.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Decent but Could be Better
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
content: If Amazon was going to do customer Alexa voices, Samuel L. Jackson is probable the first one you could think of wanting - along with Morgan Freeman or James Earl Jones.  For 0.99 cents, it's a no-brainer.  I do wish you had the ability to have it just respond instead of having to "ask Sam Jackson...", but I believe that's a limitation of how the skill is implemented, at least for now.  The biggest disappointment is the lack of explicit content, even when enabling it.  I think anyone adding Sam Jackson as a voice also wants to hear his infamous explicit flair.  But I've only heard spotty things once or twice, so it's really not that bad.  I could understand toning it down if this was the default voice for Alexa, but since I need to ask Alexa to "ask Sam Jackson..." every time, I think it's pretty obvious that I want explicit answers.All that said, it's a fun addition and I see it as only the beginning of the continued evolution of Alexa's possibilities.

content: Of course, this should be a wonderful addition to Alexa's repertoire, but one is required to basically: Ask Alexa to Ask SLJ what Time it is. Or Ask Alexa top ASK SLJ what the weather is. By completely removing any way to use a different "Wake Word" (That's what it is , essentially), you make me curious as to why ALL manufacturers that I know of, all adhere to this policy.Where does that Order come from? content: you can't simply replace the existing Alexa voice with Sam Jackson's voice permanently, which was my intention. title: THIS is what Alexa was invented for!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
content: When I heard that I could get Samuel L. Jackson's voice to come out of my Alexa, I thought it must be too good to be true. But, after a few mouse clicks, my Alexa has suddenly learned to skillfully use profanity along with all sorts of other colorful language! (Relax, Karen, you can easily turn off the more colorful language if that doesn't suit you.)My entire family loves having our new favorite adjunct family member Sam Jackson answer even the most mundane questions, and even gives us inspirational pep-talks if the situation warrants it. ("Alexa, ask Samuel L. Jackson 'Where's my super suit?'" Sam: "You don't NEED a Super Suit to be Incredible.") And, he's SO polite, too! ("Alexa, tell Samuel L. Jackson 'thank you'." Sam: "My pleasure!")Frankly, even though he's only been with us a few days, I struggle to remember what life was like before Sam came. Click the "Buy" button right away. You need more of this in your life...no matter who you are.(Note:  My original draft of this review was deemed "unacceptable" by Amazon, since I actually specified some of the more colorful words Samuel L. Jackson says, redacted with asterisks over the middle part of the word.  If seeing such language in a review would offend you, I would recommend turning OFF the colorful language.  It's easy to do in the Alexa app, and you might save yourself from distress.)

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Interesting but not a replacement for Alexa's normal voice
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
content: Although this can be quite entertaining for awhile, it is technically an unnecessary purchase. A lot of users are buying into this thinking that this will actually "change" Alexa's normal voice, however that isn't true. This "adds" the ability to "also" use Mr. Jackson's voice (in addition to Alexa's normal voice). You have to ask Alexa "Hey Alexa, ask Samuel Jackson for the weather".  However, if you simply talk to Alexa like you would normally, you will get Alexa's normal voice in return. So this is nothing more than a skill you trigger with specific words ("ask Samuel Jackson..."). Thankfully, we walked into this knowing exactly what it was, so we had a lot of fun with it. However in the end, that's all it was. A fun trick until everyone got bored with it. Now, if you could replace Alexa's normal voice with it (like some of the TomTom options of the past), that would earn a solid five stars.

title: Works only with newer generations
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
content: I had the same problem as many others where I had to ask "Alexa, ask Samuel...." and that was irritating because the instructions state I should be able to say, "Hey Samuel."  Another reviewer said he didn't have this problem (and was confused by all the comments) so I knew something was wrong. After some research I determined I was using a 1st generation Echo which is not supported with this skill. I have a newer Dot so I tried it on that and it worked perfectly. The way you can tell is the Alexa app will not let you turn on the Celebrity feature if you have an older Echo, but the option is there with newer devices. After choosing the Celebrity feature on my Dot, it worked perfectly and I can now say "Hey Samuel" to my Dot. It is a fun feature and worth $1.99  for the entertainment.

content: I thought it was something like "Alexa, tell me a joke".  Just a little funny thing we can do with Alexa. REALLY??  Other voices are free, but his you need to pay for, but there was never a confirmation from Alexa like, this will charge you $5.  It just charged me without telling me the price or that there even was a price....I went in to try and "return" it and I wasn't able to.  I'm not going to kill myself over $5, so I just let it go, but next time I'll be more wary.

title: Not what I was expecting

content: Amazon promoted this to seem like it was a new "voice" for Alexa.  Instead it's an add on that Alexa can control, but you have to ask Alexa to ask Samuel for information.  I was really hoping I could change the normal Alexa voice to Sam's voice and have it tell me the weather, not "Alexa, ask Samuel what the weather is going to be today".  Really disappointing.  As far as functionality, it works the way it's supposed to..I guess.  I really wish I had read the reviews before purchasing, because I'm most likely not going to use this.  As trivial as it may seem, having to add the extra step in my morning routine to have Samuel Jackson tell me the weather forecast just isn't something I'm going do.

skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Glitches

content: I have two Echo dots on my work desk that I use in stereo mode. One of them typically "hears" my requests and half the time it tell me I have to buy the voice. Why? Because the Dot, which is in my name and configured by my phone, somehow switches to my wife's account. What is my wife's "account"? And why does it switch? And why does that even matter when it comes to the voice? I switch the "account" over, but it somehow switches back. It's very frustrating. So I've had to disable the microphone on that device so that the device 3ft to the left listens. For some inexplicable reason, that one never switches accounts. Very disappointing.

content: I am a big Samuel Jackson fan, so don't get me wrong, I love asking questions with Sam at the helm.  But...you have to ask Alexa, to ask Sam, what your question is. skillname: Samuel L. Jackson‚Äìcelebrity personality for Alexa
title: Amazon testing the market, not a real product yet ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
content: Enabling celebrity voice to fully replace Alexa voice is probably a significant investment for Amazon. Before fully investing down that path, I think Amazon is just polling the market to see if there is enough demand for this type of product, which is also evident in the initial $0.99 promotional price. If there's enough people trying it and unhappy with it's current limited ability, it's a sign that it may be worth further investing to fully develop it. If not, it's just $0.99 so hopefully people who bought it aren't super mad about how little the current version does.

title: A masterpiece of minimalist fiction
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
content: Patrick Star's epic tale reaches literary heights few authors dream of. Yes, the tale is a tragedy and poignantly examines the role of death, self-image and society's  difficulty in accepting the "other" but the work succeeds as a triumph of terse craftsmanship and deeply affecting prose. Recommended, if you have the time to absorb it all.

skillname: Melissa McCarthy - celebrity personality for Alexa
title: Very limited and disappointing.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2021
content: I am such a HUGE Melissa fan that when I heard she was a new voice for Alexa, I ran out and bought a $60 Alexa device despite having a totally Google home setup. I was then shocked to learn that I had to pay an additional $4.99 for the Melissa voice package (Google provides celebrity voice add-ons for FREE, including John Legend and Issa Rae.)I paid up, and it has turned out to be a real disappointment. "Hey Melissa Tell Me a Story" gets you some cute antecdotes from her life told by her, but there are only, like, six of them and then they start to repeat. "Hey Melissa Tell me a joke" is fun, and there does seem to be a fairly good supply of those so that it doesn't run out too fast.Other than that, there are some cute asides to regular requests. If you ask her to set an alarm, she says "Normally I don't want to alarm people but I...I get where you're going with that..." and if you ask for a weather report she has some cute comments like "Trying to decide to wear, eh?" and so forth.But by and large there just isn't a lot added onto the feature to justify charging extra for it, and to be honest I'm probably going to return my new Alexa device and call it a $5 investment in a few chuckles for a few days.

skillname: Melissa McCarthy - celebrity personality for Alexa
title: As a huge fan....I'm kinda disappointed
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
content: I LOVE Melissa McCarthy so I jumped on this purchase. It is her most the time however very limited to what she can do. When she reads some things you can tell it's not her (to be fair I'd be impossible for her to prerecord every single city for things like weather)I was mainly disappointed when she "tells a joke" They're all REALLY bad like dad jokes for a 7 year old. I want raunchy funny Melissa lolShe can only do weather, news, alarms/timers, tell a few jokes and give "advice" she doesn't work with any other "skills"

title: Entertaining but a little light
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2021
content: This voice I find to be pretty fun to listen to ... telling jokes, short stories, or just the time.  The only thing I don't like about it (compared to the other two celebrity voices Samuel L. Jackson and Shaq) is that it feels a little "light" on material maybe, or perhaps just too tame and kid-friendly.  I'm an adult, and I prefer not to hear child-approved content.  But that aside, it is a fairly diverse voice with a lot of material and is easily recognized by my Echo Dot when I ask.

skillname: Melissa McCarthy - celebrity personality for Alexa
title: Don't set your expectations too high
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
content: I'm a big fan of Melissa McCarthy so when the offer for her personality on Alexa came up, I was happy to know I'd get to hear her voice and some of her stories. The stories she shares are interesting if you're a fan. If not, I don't think you'd be interested to hear many of them. The reason I'm giving a low rating is because of the integration. I realize she doesn't have time to sit and record a response for every question I ask, that's expecting too much. However, it would be great if there were a way for Alexa to take over. If the Melissa feature can't help, then have it automatically switch over to Alexa so I don't have to ask again. Something like, "I'm sorry, I can't help with that but Alexa can." Other than that, it's okay if you're not expecting too much from it.

skillname: Melissa McCarthy - celebrity personality for Alexa
title: Love Melissa McCarthy, HATE this feature!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2021
content: I have the Sam Jackson voice for my Alexa and it was great as an alarm in the morning, but then my Alexa suggested Melissa Mcacarthy as another celebrity voice I‚Äôd like. I agreed with my Alexa and promptly purchased her voice package to add to the mix. I decided to switch to her voice for my alarm the following morning. BIG MISTAKE!!! I‚Äôm woken up to the sound of a weird hippy chord being strummed on a guitar and an equally hippy nasally sound of what I assume is singing about looking out the window at a rain storm and she doesn‚Äôt want to be there cause she would rather be, and I quote, ‚Äúanywhere but here‚Äù. Well guess what Melissa? Me too. I bought this voice package under the assumption that it‚Äôd be comedic. It was literally the antithesis of anything that could be remotely considered funny. It was pure garbage and made me feel like I‚Äôd somehow relocated to the inner bowels of Portland or Seattle. And now I can‚Äôt get rid of her off my Alexa even when I said disable her voice and put Sam Jackson back, she STILL WAKES ME UP!!! üò´üò≠üò´üò≠üò´üò≠ Stick with Sam and like Nancy Reagan said, ‚ÄúJust Say No‚Äù to Melissa McCarthy‚Äôs voice package. Stop trying to be a serious musician.I‚Äôll still see every movie of hers though. She‚Äôs not singing in those.

skillname: Melissa McCarthy - celebrity personality for Alexa
title: Loved it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2021
content: I stumbled across this Melissa skill; normally I wouldn't pay for oddball functions like this but I do like most of her movies. I didn't think I would like having the combo wake words like the 'oogle uses.. but "Hey Melissa" does flow pretty good. Instead of using the enable it on all compatible devices, I simply went to each room and threw the "echo, introduce me to Melissa" on each device.. All of them began the intro. 'She' does handle the basic turn things on and off and most other vocal functions. 'She' will hand shopping and other lists, "wheres my stuff" to the standard voice. I asked it for the weather and was surprised it was her voice and a little quip about it and they even made the effort to use the segmenting tech to put the weather details in her voice also. That left me a little puzzled..if they made the effort to make the digital segments for weather details.. why didn't they continue on to cover lists, and the other stuff handled off to Alexa...  I do hope the voices become a lot more integrated into everything that we have to interact with, I may buy more allowing each person to have their echo individualized.  Overall though, Very happy with it, it was super simple to activate and a lil fun having a real celebs voice.

title: Sympathetic Interviewer
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021
content: I just was interviewed by Mackenzie for her podcast. She is so empathetic, letting her interviewees talk as much as they want to before following up with her next question. The cardinal sin of interviewers is to impose their views on the person they're interviewing. B=y contrast Mackenzie offers an outstanding example of someone who knows how to draw out her subject in the most unobtrusive manner possible. Listen to her podcasts. They are exceptional.

title: Mackenzie is a passionate and curious host
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
content: Mackenzie personifies everything that's great about Gen Z. She's bright, inquisitive and curious. She interviews guests from a wide variety of fields and asks probing and intriguing questions in her interviews. I highly recommend her podcast for the curious at heart.

title: Mackenzie is awesome!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
content: Mackenzie was amazing with my interview, she made me feel comfortable and open to talk about my life, career and my trajectory of coming to America to pursue my dreams. The interview went so smooth that I felt we were besties talking and laughing about situations we confronted in our lives!If you didn‚Äôt yet, subscribe and stay tuned for other amazing interviews that are coming soon.

title: impressed with gen z ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
content: I loved listening to these Gen Z'rs and hearing how they are really going to make a difference in the world. Mackenzie has great interviewing skills. The interaction of getting interviewed by someone from your own generation seems to really bring out the best (and make it very interesting). Looking forward to hearing more.

title: Not particularly useful; should go back to the drawing board
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
content: Poor design. One of the first things an aspiring student is likely to ask about is a major: "Medicine," or "journalism," or "political science," for instance. The app doesn't seem to recognize such areas of study.It asks users to select one of (just) four universities‚Äîwhich is probably not the way most people will want to study their academic options in Cincinnati (which no doubt has many more than four options for higher education, too).Instead of Pick a university --> Learn more about that university  --> Then pick another university ‚Ä¶A more user-centric design would go like this:Pick a program or curriculum  --> Universities that offer that program or curriculum  -->  Pick a university to hear details about that program or curriculum  --> Pick another university or program and begin againThe skill mispronounces at least one word it should definitely know: "Xavier," one of the four universities it profiles.Worst of all, the skill doesn't recognize the standard "Alexa, pause," command and instead says, "No worries," and returns to the start. I had a hard time getting it to be quiet.

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: Laughter Matters more now than ever
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
content: I recently had the privilege of hearing Kent Rader at a conference in July.  He truly inspired me to return to work and bring laughter with me.  I work in a public school and I shared this desire with my director.  So I am going to post several light hearted motivational quotes around our building with the hopes it will give our staff a bright moment in their day.  We need much more laughter in our days as we face the beginning of the school year and what that might look like for all.  Thank you Kent for sharing laughter!

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: This Man Is A Legend
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
content: Kent is extremely funny and family friendly. He‚Äôll put a smile on your face every day you listen in. Kent‚Äôs story‚Äôs will make you feel happy as can be even on a gloomy day. My family and I often find ourselves quoting his stand up.

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: It keeps me coming back!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
content: This is an awesome addition to anyone's Flash Briefing! Kent keeps the jokes clean and makes you laugh making with things that have happened to him in his life. The presentation is great and the sound quality is good. It's a must enable!

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: Thoughtful & humorous short daily read/listen
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
content: Kent Rader's Flash Briefings are humorous, worth every minute you spend with them.  You can even go back & listen -- or read -- to any you missed from before.  Be prepared to chuckle.  Each laugh is equivalent to one stomach crunch, so relax & enjoy!

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: Brightens my day
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
content: I love to to hear his stories each day, I made it the last thing on my flash briefing so that I end it on a good note to help start my day off a little lighter. Laughter definitely matters, thanks for keeping it fresh on my mind.

skillname: Laughter Matters - Clean Comedy & Stress Reduction
title: great for unwinding and enjoying a break from the hectic life!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
content: Kent is very good at presenting the common everyday things we're familiar with in a new, whimsical light. His down home delivery and clean style leave lasting impressions and I find myself remembering his words during the day. Laughter is the best medicine and he delivers just the right dose.

title: Amazon is Amazing
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022
content: Within the past few months we have started using Amazon as our main delivery service. I would like to compliment the outstanding job your delivery drivers and customer service providers do. Anything that is able to be purchased from your company, that can wait a day or so will be purchased from Amazon from here on out. Thank you for offering such a great and convenient service.

title: Amazon service is incomparably superb!
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
content: I am currently in South Korea and use Coupang, a Korean version (?) of Amazon, during my stay here since there's no Amazon service available here. Coupang was recently IPO'ed on NYSE but strongly recommend you sell the stocks if you bought them. Products on Coupang do not carry any description about the products they sell, just pictures. I purchased an edible product based on the product name of "bar" as it implies the product is a dried one like edible bars we can see on market. However, it was not bar but a real food which SHOULD be stored in a freezer. Its shape was just like a bar. Who could tell it just by seeing the picture. Further, I couldn't return it because it is a real food. I feel I MUST appreciate the wonderful service of Amazon. They are supplier-oriented, while Amazon is customer-oriented. I'd like to extend my personal gratitude to all Amazon workers from the bottom of my heart. Thank you, Amazon!

title: Great Holiday Delivery Service!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021
content: Just a thank you to all responsible for handling holiday orders. Exceptional job this year! Everything I ordered came to my house when promised or before.Thank you Guys! üòä Happy & Safe Holidays to allüéÑüïé

I don‚Äôt normally go out of my way to make compliments but on this occasion this very helpful pleasant Deserves to be recognised.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022
content: It took some time to find out where to send a compliment to those who package orders.I've purchased hundreds of items and rarely do I think something was not packaged smartly.  Today, I received a box with 7 items, 1 of which was breakable with liquid vitamin inside. The glass item was packaged/wrapped with TLC, taped securely and arrived in perfect condition.  The box had bubble wrap to protect this one item, since the others were not breakable. Thank you to all who take the time to that extra step to make sure your customers get their items in perfect condition. I appreciate your work, every time I open a box.  Sincerely, EK

title: Better than Mom
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019
content: This skill is so great. After witnessing my mother exit my life and enter the last train cart on a north bound caravan wafting with drum thumping hippies, there‚Äôs been an intense void of feminine affection in my life. So much so that I‚Äôve stumbled from one woman‚Äôs arms to the next. There was Kaszcha, the Ukranian fire eater who taught me to set my gaze ahead, and Berta, the Spanish diver who taught me to look inward (Rest in Peace, Berta), and among many others. In my attempts to simmer the bubbling couldron that is that void (Mother! Why?) I find that my soul grows weary. In my attempts to grow close to these womens (not too close!), I have pushed myself to my emotional limits. However, this skill changed my life. Upon finding Assure Me, not only do I have someone to recognize the complex details in my forlorned, yet gentle, soul ‚Äî I have it in an objective, white, late-middle-aged female‚Äôs voice. When I‚Äôm wondering who‚Äôs paying attention to the sheer capacity of fastidious love I have to give, when I‚Äôm wondering if there‚Äôs anyone who sees me beyond my wild and whimsically Arcadian exterior, when I‚Äôm wondering how many times I‚Äôve blinked in a day, I turn to this skill. With it, I‚Äôve found that I no longer need jocular validation from a fulsome gaggle of women. In this skill, I have discovered my own luminous ability to give MYSELF the love that I need. Thank you, Assure Me. You have saved me.

title: What a dumbed down waste!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
content: Technology is available for Alexa to say "BLESS YOU" anytime you sneeze yet - for whatever reason - Amazon won't make it anymore (yes, they used to)!  If you need to tell Alexa you just sneezed - that takes out the whole novelty of having her....  Oh just nevermind!!  :-(Also - why nothing for when a cat meows?!  Sure Alexa can say something clever if a dog barks - but nothing for their feline counterparts?  LAME!That said - I actually do LOVE everything else about Alexa.  It's a wonderful tech!  A good example of "how it ought to be" with tech.  So good at everything else - it makes it just that much more of a disappointment that she won't say "Bless You" when i sneeze!  Frustrating!

It is also great for a sarcastic sense of humor and will make you laugh.  Which is how everyone should start their day.  There are already too many serious people in this world. title: I have a lot of fun with this one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
content: It lets you get interactive with Alexa.  I do have a few minor (?) suggestions...Add some trigger words that are not as awkward and forgettable as "(Alexa) ask good vibe..."  Maybe something like "(Alexa) Please tell me..."  or (Alexa) Please answer this..."Get rid of the censorship (unless Amazon requires it.)  Or make it a switch in the web setup application to censor with the beep or not to censor.  Let's face it, people will like hearing Alexa talk a bit "naughty."If possible, add the ability to pause and/or emphasize in the response scripts.Give the ability to respond with a response dependent on what the user says after the defined answer is played.  For example, maybe if the user responds with "Thank You" it says "You're Welcome"  OR if the user says, "That's not right" it says "Sorry., I'll try to do better next time."Or, nicer still, if the question is something like, "I am looking for a birthday"  I would respond, "whose birthday would you like to know? The user might say, "Joe's" or "Mary Smith's" and it would respond with the correct date.

title: Best Way To Add Custom Content to Your Alexa Echo Device, But Could Use Some Changes
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2018
content: ******EDITED 11-1-2018******Previously (below) I stated "Good Vibe was one of the best Alexa skills thus far" which was true at the time of my writing that review.  However, this has since changes and with Alexa Blueprints, you can do everything that Good Vibe does but MORE and Blueprints are highly customized for YOUR Echo device or Alexa app - for example, you don't have to ask the Echo to open an app to then open a customized script, with Blueprints you directly access the script by simply asking the Echo what you programmed in your Blueprint.  This is a FREE service offered for Alexa/Echo and can be found at blueprints.amazon.com and is MUCH better than the Good Vibe app is.-----------OLD REVIEW FOLLOWS BELOW THIS LINE -------------This is one of the best Echo Alexa skills thus far!  I love the ability to add your own audio responses from a file or recording, and I hope they expand the interjections (which are automatically inserted clips of Alexa saying phrases), and the web text-to-speech has the potential for so many different uses!  Easy to use, and once you link your account, you can use your computer to go to alexavibe.com to set up your commands and responses.There are two things I would like to ask the developers to integrate or change.  The first is the editing/bleeping of curse words - in my house, there are only two adults, and when we added "house rules" for guests to our home, it bleeped out the word bull**** when we put in "We do not tolerate any bull****.  My wife and I met in the US Navy, and we swear, well, like sailors, we're forty and we don't need our words censored.The second feature I would like the developers to work on is instead of "Alexa ask Good Vibe to" to something easier to say.  If the developers can't make it so you can just say "Ask Alexa To" then instead of Good Vibe (which sounds like an adult app, to be honest), could you allow it to be invoked by something like "Alexa ask/tell the announcer to"  or perhaps "Alexa ask/tell the presenter to".  My wife constantly confuses "good vibe" with "good vibes" so the invoke word for it is long, strange-sounding to our guests - they wonder what "good vibe" means - and also has no relation to what the app actually does.Also, it wouldn't hurt to be able to  "collapse" all of the current commands so there isn't an insane amount of scrolling to do to get to any previous commands - or paginate them somehow.  If you have a lot of custom commands and need to change the parameters there is way too much scrolling on the page you add them.But overall this is one incredible app and way of adding your own custom content to your Echo device!  I highly recommend that everyone who has an Echo device use this app.

title: Fun! And sometimes really useful like when I just ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2017
content: Fun! And sometimes really useful like when I just can't be bothered to make a decision. Flipping a coin is ok - if I have one to hand - but that only works for a choice of two options. "Either Or" means I can just ask Alexa to choose for me. And then of course there's that old problem of needing flowers to pluck petals off... "She love me, She loves me not" :D We even designed a game to play using this as to make each player's choices for them without them knowing what they'd get.

title: My Card of the Day is great skill to increase creativity and thoughtfulness
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2017
content: I have just become aware of the Alexa Skill 'My Card of the Day' and already I am a big fan.  When enabled, the skill allows you to pick your own card, and once it has been read to you, you have the option to pick an additional card if you wish.  The skill feels very organic, like you are actually working with a real person who is reading your cards for you.  I have found I look forward to having Alexa 'pick" my card each morning and help me to launch my day in a useful and creative way.

title: Good Solid Skill Which Provides Plenty Of Entertainment
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2018
content: This is a great collection of mixed/scrambled metaphors.  Some make you wonder how people come up with what they said, others are just outright hilarious.  The skill itself seems pretty solid and bulletproof.  So, if you need a good chuckle, this is highly recommended.  People who enable this skill might also like one of mine, "Crazy Anagrams".  Word-play has always been fascinating to me.  "Mixed Metaphors" is definitely a must-have in my opinion!

If I request Alexa to comment on my wife's pretty eyes she may say, "Hey wife, I could sit and talk to you all day." I thought it would be cool if Alexa could throw in a few good words for the hubby, like Iduno, Hey "wifey" <---(wife's name)You got lucky when "hubby" found you" or Hey "Wifey"<--(wife's name) I can see that "hubby"<--(husband's name) always puts you first ahead of anything else he must really love you. title: This is a humor routine, not serious cat translation
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
content: This is good for a laugh. It's not serious cat translation. That actually should be pretty clear from the description of the skill, which mentions adding sass, but it looks like some reviewers are confused about the nature of this skill.  I've tried the skill three times, each time I told it the same cat behavior, which was my cat was eating. Each time I got a different answer that gave me a chuckle. Clearly, it's just giving random responses to whatever you describe. But it is worth it for the laugh, and sometimes it really describes my cat well just by accident.

title: Best cat app out there
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2018
content: Last month I kidnapped my neighbor's cat. You know, as a hilarious prank. Nathan has taken a lot longer than I expected to come up with the ransom money, so I've had to take care of Mr. Bojangles for a lot longer than I expected. And he doesn't talk, since he's, you know, a cat.For the last three weeks I've left out a can of tuna for Mr. Bojangles, and he wouldn't eat it. Aren't all cats supposed to love tuna?! He lost 6.4 lbs, and I wasn't sure what to do. Nathan won't give me the full ransom money if his cat is in bad health. Three days ago, he finally ate the tuna and then I found chunks of tuna all over my carpet.I couldn't tell what happened, but thanks to this app, I was able to figure out that Mr. Bojangles is allergic to seafood! Now I know that I should feed him something better like raw eggs, since he'll need protein to get his weight back up. Thanks Cat Translator!

title: Looking out the window means seriously ill?! wth?!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
content: This app is misrepresented. It does not translate your cat's sounds/voice, nor does it "speak" to your cat in any way. Alexa says she can "interpret cat behavior" and asks YOU what you're cat is doing. Ok, I'll play along, I thought.So I answered that my cat is listening at the door for a cat that was eating on the front porch. Alexa responded that my cat is trying to tell me "she loves me and wants to spend the rest of her 9 lives with me". How cute. But this cat is a boy, so I think she's off a bit.I gave it one more try and to my horror, this response was both wacky and a cruel. I told Alexa my cat was chasing a bug on the outside of the window pane. Alexa's response? Here it is, and you can hopefully use it to decide if you want this skill for your unit."Your cat is seriously ill and needs to go the vet.....Or your cat has gas. I always get those two confused."REALLY????? REALLY AMAZON???? REALLY ALEXA????

title: THIS GAME IS THE PWN
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2017
content: This a simple port of the text-based calculator game. To start quick,decline the tutorial, say "buy weed" (you can say "buy broccoli" insteadif you feel more comfortable with that), then "go to queens", once youget there, "sell everything". You'll probably turn a decent profit andhave enough of a cushion to explore the rest of the city and get a senseof the prices ("check prices").If you want the full list of commodity name substitutions, say "alexa,my kids are home" and "check prices". To switch back, say "alexa, thecoast is clear". You can always interrupt the dialog using the wakeword, and then issue a command ("alexa, inventory").Just in case you never played the original, the game is a simplecommodity trading simulator where you have 30 turns to make as muchmoney as possible. If you're having any trouble getting alexa tounderstand you, I definitely recommend taking a few minutes to do thevoice training on the alexa app. It will improve your experience notjust with dope wars, but with every other alexa skill. It's not such abig deal for "yes or no" games, but this has a bunch of differentcommands, so alexa can get confused if she hasn't learned your voiceyet.It was a pleasure helping to write some of the text for this skill, andI hope anyone who played the original enjoys it. it!

title: Starts off good, but needs better and more jokes
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2016
content: I played this Alexa Skill on Fire TV.  I really wanted to like it because I thought the kids would get a kick out of it on Christmas, but there are two problems.The first is that the few first jokes were, well, groan-inducingly horrible.  There are better "knock knock" jokes out there than the first few I heard with this Skill.  The second problem is that I played seven jokes in a row and, of that, there were are least two repeats.  Later on, I re-tried this Skill and nearly all of the same jokes as I had already heard were told again.  Groan...On the plus side, you can simply say into the Voice Remote "knock knock"; you don't have to say "ask Knock Knock to tell me a joke."  Alexa will respond by saying "knock knock".  That's your cue to now say into the Voice Remote "who's there?"  Alexa might say "snow".  You respond into the Voice Remote "snow who?"  Then, Alexa completes the joke (as bad as it is).In summary, I really like the ease of invoking the Skill and how you can interact with Alexa as you normally would with a knock knock joke.  If you don't interact properly, Alexa will let you know it.However, the selection of jokes needs work both in the quality of the jokes and to prevent repetition after just a few jokes.I hope the developer continues to work on it because I think it's clever, it plays well on Fire TV, and it could be a really great Skill.

title: Activated unintentionally in a serious meeting with lots of people
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
content: Amazon‚Äôs policy of turning on skills without confirmation really let off a big one in an important meeting. I said something that the Echo in the next room interpreted as ‚ÄúAlexa fart‚Äù, and it logged three separate activities for it, enabling this skill and activating it, so it started farting in my general direction while I had the mic in a video call of many people.  While this was somewhat amusing in concept, it was much less so in practice. It rather damages one‚Äôs perception among one‚Äôs peers to be screaming at a farting robot to stop.Based on the other reviews here, this app seems problematic for a number of reasons. I believe Amazon should consider yanking it.
