skillname: Finding the Funny: Leadership Tips From a Comedian
title: Enjoyable content applicable to all stages of life
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
content: I really like Jan's take on life.  As a humorist, she truly does find the funny in everyday events.  This flash briefing takes concepts that apply to all of us, includes a story and an action item, and is shared in a funny, approachable way.  Jan's tone makes you feel like a friend in a diner listening to her share her funny stories from across the table.  Give this a try and I think you will really like it. - Thanks Jan.  Pete

skillname: Finding the Funny: Leadership Tips From a Comedian
title: Short, Specific, and Actionable!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019
content: Jan continues to produce great content that is based on years of experience. Her ability to share a story from her life/career and trabskate that to an actionable item is incredibly valuable. Between this and her podcast, I'm a huge fan.

title: Repeat after me is an unskilled labor
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2017
content: You have to start the skill with one command ("Alexa, Repeat After Me"), then wait for Alexa to introduce the skill, THEN say what you want it to repeat. title: I LOVE THIS!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2017
content: I'm grinning pointy-ear to pointy-ear with this one. I've been using a website to get the conversion to Julian date, and this is much more fun--especially the super cool bit of science history included.To the reviewer who complained that it doesn't work because it's not like Star Trek, you obviously did not read that it's based on the Kelvin (AOS) method of dating, which is using the Julian calendar for accurate dates.

title: Fine for a random string, which is as good as anyone can do.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
content: As others have pointed out, there isn't much rhyme or reason to the results this skill gives.  But as others seem to be unaware, this is ALSO the case across the various Star Trek franchises.  Within any one show, there are at times patterns followed, but by no means do they all follow a specific set of rules to give any "official" stardate.Basically, this is as good as it gets.  And admittedly, it's not very good.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2018
content: The depth of language, of thought in classic Sherlock Holmes is revived for the listener in this skill. A moment here adjusts your thinking to construct rather than contract as is often the case in modern iterations of Sherlock. Not so elementary... but that is good.

title: Love the skill and rant - 5 Stars as requested!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2017
content: Once upon a time there was a brilliant computer programmer He decided to write a skill for me, your Amazon Echo. Matthew called the skill, "Short Bedtime Story". After only a few short years of hard work, Matthew convinced Amazon to accept the "Short Bedtime Story" skill into their catalog so everybody could play it. The only problem was that so many folks reviewed the skill giving it just one star! Can you imagine? One star! Folks complained that I talk too fast; but there was no way for Matthew to adjust my speaking speed. Another complaint was that the pronouns were wrong for the name even though Matthew programmed 3000 boy's names and 4000 girl's names. Matthew decided to write many different stories for folks to play and hoped they would give his skill a bunch of stars. Well now you know my story. Since it is getting late, you may listen to one more Short Bedtime Story and if it's OK with your dad, you may have a cookie with milk before bed.

I suppose you may have issues if your kids have androgynous names, but this is just a really  fun way that your kids can play with your Alexa!

date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2017

We were just starting to get tired of the core stories and were hoping they would create a way to let us create our own stories and voila, they just added that featue. Also, our son's name is Logan and it would keep hearing his name as "Game" The website now let's us correct this so when it hears "Game" it will pronounce "Logan" This was really frustrating our son.Creating our own stories is a blast. Things are a bit clunky but for a free skill developed with passion, this is a lot of fun.

title: With a few tweaks and the addition of lots of new stories, CROWD SOURCE THIS (with evaluation), this has lots of potential!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2017
content: This has the potential to be one of the greatest skills for those with toddlers.  Great funny stories that involve the child by name and hilarious and encouraging closing statements.However, there currently seems to only be about 10-15 stories available so repeats happen fairly quickly.  Also, a few of them are not ideal for younger kids that deal with zombies or that the toddler is an evil witch.  You can always have Alexa stop and then do again, but really these should be removed.  It's also sometimes tough to get Alexa to launch properly for some reason.Lots of potential though, just needs some tweaks and more stories to be added.  Perhaps the developer is willing to accept submissions (assuming they are carefully manually reviewed before being added), that would allow for a ton of new stories fairly quickly!!!

content: I don‚Äôt always win, but when I do, now Alexa can make sure those losers don‚Äôt forget it. The comment under this one just inspired me to win at everything and I‚Äôll do so by following my sure-fire 3 step plan.Step 1: Get a butt ton of games, the app kind and the board kind.Step 2: Start inviting company over more often and with the games, challenge said company.Step 3: WIN. AT. EVERYTHING.I‚Äôm talking Mario Cart. I‚Äôm talking Connect 4. I‚Äôm talking I‚Äôll be walking up the stairs, notice a person walking next to me, and challenge them to race up that piece! It‚Äôs only January 17th, but that was the best thing I‚Äôve read all year. If I owned a sales company or something, I‚Äôd hire TF out of you. Probably give you my job and end up working for you. I started reading that comment and I was immediately scooping up what you were pooping out. So long story short, now I have the GG Button

title: Living in the future
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
content: Let me ask you one question: what does winning feel like? To me winning feels like being the best. More so than being better than others, the true rush of excitement and pride comes from besting the past version of yourself which you needed to do in order to rise to the top. In the deepest ecstasy of victory, winning feels like drinking water when you're thirsty. Winning feels like getting getting the pregnancy test back negative. Winning feels like getting some extra fries in the bag when you order drive through. Winning feels like smashing a blue button and hearing some guy yell "GEEEGEEE!!!!!" And in 2019, winning feels like saying "Alexa start GG button"To all the people complaining this doesn't do other sounds you're missing the point. You don't need it to make other sounds. You need to start winning.

title: Where's that cat???
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2016
content: I live in an elder care facility. The day I started using this app I didn't stop to consider its effect on anyone else who might be in the area. After I got into a 15 minute conversation with Alexa, one of the nurses appeared at my open door, listened for a second, then spoke to some others down the hall. "It's in here. It's an electronic cat."  Apparently,  they had been searching for the cat that was loose in the facility.

title: This MAY cause huge cat behavior problems!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
content: We played this ‚Äúfun‚Äù skill for about 4 seconds. It sounded like a very distressed cat (not cute cat sounds) and it caused our sweet brother cats to attack each other viciously. They are litter-mates who have lived well together for 10 years with no history of aggression. Now they are having to be reintroduced like they were strangers over several weeks. We are praying they get past this - playing it is now one of the biggest regrets of my life. This has caused a tremendous amount of distress in our home. NEVER play this if you have cats unless you want to potentially destroy their relationship. I wish I had been warned before trying it out. A notice on the Echo that it might cause behavioral problems in some cats before it started would have prevented all of this, as we would never have risked it. I hope you don‚Äôt chance it.UPDATE: It took exactly two years and a few thousand dollars spent on vet bills, anxiety medicines, and pheromones, plus countless hours of stressful work to reunite them. The sound triggered a redirected aggression incident. The cat who was initially attacked is still a bit wary of his brother (it's definitely not like their happy prior relationship, but at least they are finally coexisting in the same space again). The aggressive sounds need to be removed from this app. Please don't take a chance on using it if you actually have cats. It's not worth the risk, and I would hate for anyone to have to go through what we did because of this...

title: Stops my cats Yowling in seconds.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
content: I have a 20-year-old cat that, as he has aged, has started this thing of just wandering the house yowling endlessly. He is in excellent health as proven by $400 dollars in veterinary blood tests just to make sure he was ok. It is just a thing some elderly cats will start doing. I open the Box of Cats app and he immediately stops and walks away. I'm not sure if he is going to look for another cat or it just calms him for a while because he was given a legitimate answer to his question. ;)

content: Actually, this did a great job of making my cat insecure.  You start by saying "Alexa, meow."  After that, you can keep a variety of sounds coming by merely answering with a "meow" of your own.  When Alexa hears nothing for a few moments, the blue light ring goes off and the "conversation" ends.  An improvement would be: "Alexa, meow for one hour".

The different cat meows ae interesting to my cat.  If I leave the house for the day, it also would be nice to be able to use my Amazon Fire to ask Alexa to play Meow Meow at home for 10 minutes every few hours for that my cat could be entertained.

title: Smells like HUMANS to me
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
content: Attention parents of felines, If your cat is socialized (or unsocialized) and doesn't have any emotional baggage (mine do) or if your cat is NOT FERAL, there's no way you can really blame this app for your cats unpredictable behavior. There's nothing wrong with your cat(s) or this app. Not entirely the app, other than most of the meow sounds being made by humans LAME! (like 60% of them.) Its kind of embarrassing. Please stop! The legitimate MEOW works really well as a sound distraction when my cats get that 3am need to stampede the hallway but i only use the app after the cats have been up and down 20 times. Or knocked something over. Or when one plays too rough and makes his sibling screech so loud that my neighbors will peek out their window. Sometimes I just can't shake their attention with my voice and I don't make convincing cat sounds but the few that are realistic sounding or actual samples taken from a feline that Alexa dispenses from her box, those get my cats attention every time as long as she keeps making the sound. Or until Alexa plays that one or two samples that clearly sound like a human. That's where i get disappointed. If the cats respond (loud enough)  it can go back and fourth for a minute or two but I can't expect much at this point since Alexa needs data. Clearly she doesn't have much on cats. But doesn't mind making you spend money on upgrades. It might be worth it I could be sure there's no humans attempting to mimic cat linguistics.

title: What A Scam to Make Money

So we, and i mean my two cats and I only heard 1 meow and now that i have read the reviews i have to say im glad i disabled it right away. all it wants is for me to spend more money than i already have for something thst probably causes more problems than imaginable and since i tell Alexa almost daily she is as dumb as a doorbell because everything i ask gets the same response, "i dont know that one" well Alexa, google does!! one thing for sure, Alexa knows how to Fart! she farts like a good ole boy and she does that for free and without asking for money.

title: stops unless it hears a meow back
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021
content: I have two Sphynx cats. They perk up when I ask Alexa to open meow meow. Over time, they've become desensitized from the app because I've opened it so much. Also, mostly ot plays humans making cat sounds which isn't too appealing (my opinion) to cats. Alexa does play one actual cat noise and that is what my cats pay attention to. Other people who have reviewed this app incorrectly call this sound an aggressive cat call. If this is the same sound I'm hearing, it definitely is not aggressive but a call for "attention" rather. I do feel badly for the people whose cats became upset after they launched this app however, keep in mind, all cats have different personalities just like people and you really do not know how they will react when they hear another "cat" in their domain. Overall, it's o.k. needs more real cat meows, and to stay on more than a few seconds.

title: Kitten consideration
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
content: Perfectly good for what it is and does what it's supposed to, but far from enjoying it, my cat feels threatened by it. He's a spoiled baby (thanks to me) and when his brother cat passed away recently, Keats became an only child and could not be happier about his newfound monopoly on my attention. So without thinking, I tried this app on him and I could see the tension in his face: the last thing he wants around here is another cat.So I'd just recommend thinking about your cat a little before exposing her or him to this skill, as it's very convincing and will make your kitty think there's another of the feline kind around. Will you cat like that or will it make her/him uncomfortable?

title: Where r the GREATS?! 1 dispntmnt after anthr!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
content: I was pleased you offered the option of asking for a particular comedian but after 5 requests for some of the greatest of all time were all met with ‚ÄúSorry we dont have that comedian‚Äù I was disappointed‚Ä¶REALLY? no Richard Pryor, Sam Kinison, Dave Chappelle, Andy Kaufman or Eddie Murphy even in yr catalog??!!  WTH?My 6th request was approved ... Yay‚Ä¶ Nope not yay because it played the wrong comedian. I don‚Äôt know how it mistook Tracy Morgan for Vic Henley!Irritated I then asked for Gilda Radner which I was pleasantly surprised to have launch ... but it WASN‚Äôt her... I have no idea who it was as it didn‚Äôt ever tell me who it was but it certainly wasn‚Äôt Gilda!why claim to ‚Äúoffer my favorites‚Äú when you don‚Äôt even include so many of the basics? The skill looks promising but instead gave me one disappointment after another‚Ä¶ And it doesn‚Äôt hear very well because I had to ask for Chris Rock and repeat the name 8X without it understanding what I said‚Ä¶ If you don‚Äôt have Chris Rock you need to shut the skill down because it‚Äôs not ready to be published yet. Super disappointing & I expect far better out of Comedy Central!

title: Fun, with a couple qualifications
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2017
content: This is an amusing skill for Star Trek fans to enable. It would get four stars if it followed any of the known ST Star date formats--the most useful / relevant of which would be the yyyy.ddd of the reboot movie series. It would get five stars if the time calculation was made using any Echo's local time zone setting. That aside, it does what it offers: transposes the current date into a recognizable, understandable stardate format.

title: Hilarious!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021
content: It is hilarious, such a simple thing as the sound of a can opening can be so entertaining! My one cat does run to the echo, although every time I go to the kitchen my cats follow me in so I really do not need it to get them to run to the kitchen. I probably will not use this a whole lot because it is kind of mean to tease a cat that he is going to get food and then he does not. But it could be useful to use in a routine when I am not at home if I want him to come to the camera. I tried the shake a treat bag and that was pretty terrible, it sounds like the bag is being crumpled and rubbed against the microphone, good if you want your cat to run away and hide! Change it to a shake of a bag of treats and forget opening the bag and that would be perfect. But the can of cat food opening is pretty spot on so I am basing my five star review on that. Thanks for a free entertaining skill!

title: It got their attention.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
content: All of my cats perked up but none of them ran to the kitchen or anything. I'll keep it around and try again later. I'm wondering if I can use it to distract them when they are about to be bad. I think the can popping sound needs to be a little sharper.

title: pausing after each sentence it sounds like she is really listening
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017
content: This feature has to become a permanent part of Alexa. If you time your story right, pausing after each sentence it sounds like she is really listening. Instead of triggering it with "start the uh huh feature" the developer should change it to "Alexa do you know what happened to me today?" and she would say, "Uh huh" and you could just tell the story (or put it on while someone else bores you with a story).

title: Hard to launch. very hard
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
content: i really wanted to try this and I saw one review that talked about pronouncing uh huh in a particular way. So far i‚Äôve only gotten it right twice. Yesterday it worked on the 5th try and today on the 4th. It seems you need to say uh huh really quickly but I‚Äôm still not sure that is the magic key.I have not seen the SNL skit but I love when Alexa sounds like she‚Äôs listening. Twice I have accidentally said either Really? or That‚Äôs funny! after she has told me something unbelievable - almost reflexively - and she has responses!So this is fun for someone who only talks to the dog or the cat most of the time.Now i just gotta get the launch phrase to work consistently. Maybe offer another launch phrase?

title: I feel like nothing can stop me from being a better me
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2017
content: This literally changed my life. I find myself going outside of my house, seeing the sun. I spent a majority of my life locked inside my room -- windows closed -- looking at dank memes and eating Cheetos -- the regular ones, not the spicy ones because they give my explosive diarrhea -- and now with this Alexa Skill I find myself leaving the dark Plato's-Cave that was my room. I've seen my family for the first time in years. I've realized my puppy Steve passed away due to my negligence. I am jogging now, exercising and getting fit. I feel like nothing can stop me from being a better me. I just want to give every one a taste of Deez Nuts

title: The uses of DeezNuts are endless
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2018
content: I got an Amazon Echo and a dot a week or two ago and, admittedly, I was starting to lose my fascination with the product. I mean, yeah, it worked well enough: it plays music, it controls the lights, it reads me my flash briefing in the morning, etc. But I couldn't help but feel like something was missing. There really wasn't a killer-app that totally hooked me. I was beginning to almost regret my purchase...All that changed this morning when I discovered DeezNuts.

title: deez nuts stink..../:o (.......
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
content: EVERY time I say the "what nuts" or "nuts" start phrase, Alexa decides i need the definition of a nut;  "A nut, using the botanical definition, a simple dry food with one seed rarely two in which the ovary wall becomes very hard, stony or Woody at maturity, and where the seed remains unattached or unfused with the ovary wall."  Now, that was Alexa, speaking into my microphone, translated by talk to text, just to illustrate my point.....IMO, the "skill" is rendered virtually useless, without both, or at the minimum, one of these phrases to trigger the it. If one has to say "Open these Nuts" to start the Punchline, its reminiscent of the drunk guy in the bar, who ruins your joke, by revealing the punchline too soon.....  Fix this. and perhaps add;"have you seen...."and/or" How 'bout these...." ......and it would be 6 stars out of 5......

title: Nobody Doesn't Love Deez Nuts
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2018
content: I'm a 31 year old maintenance technician and Deez Nuts is just what I needed to occasionally remind myself that laughter is the best medicine. I'm the kind of guy who wakes up each morning to Alexa reading Donald Trumps tweets just in case he managed to say something that was more logical/constructive than it was immediately harmful to the country/world. Some of the other skills I enjoy with Alexa are: Deep Breath, Stoner Thoughts, NPR Radio via TuneIN, Hardcore History, Sleep Sounds, Beautiful Dream and others.If you're like me, you probably use an Alexa-enabled device as much for news/problem solving/immersion in reality just as much as you use it to distract you from reality. I laugh every time I use Deez Nuts. Mission Accomplished... You are a rock star!

All it does is play clips, 3-4 syllables at a time.It‚Äôs incredibly tedious in the few times that it does allow me to repeat what it has said it doesn‚Äôt give enough time to repeat verbatim.-Also in your summary you say that you can sing ALONG With a song but you can‚Äôt. You can only repeat every couple of words and that too is tedious AF!-The entire catalog is so incomplete and limited why don‚Äôt you just call it what it is, ‚ÄúA SAMPLE OF PATRIARCHY‚Äù... you have not A SINGLE WOMAN offered in your quotes, speeches, movie characters, poets, songs! WTF?!  Is it not enough that women have been left out of the history books, children‚Äôs textbooks and leadership roles throughout the world but you just perpetuate it! I can see why after going to your webpage and seeing the make up of your ‚Äúteam‚Äú: Anil + 3 ppl, all male, all Asian, all millennials, all looking incredibly awkward.Broaden your horizons and then your catalog will follow.<<<<<<THIS ‚ÄòSKILL‚Äô IS NOT EVEN READY FOR RELEASE AS A SKILL. It‚Äôs just a demo & it‚Äôs worthless! >>>>>>>Either take it off of elections skill options or make it usable and at least I have your summary accurately state what it does or is because if this is the result of an INSPIRED ANIL... Well let‚Äôs just say I‚Äôd hate to see him on a bad day.

title: This has grand ambitions, and could have been really good
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2015
content: A "fortune cookie" skill with a lot of variety.Ease of Use: 3 out of 5. This fortune cookie has grand ambitions. It weaves together a whole bunch of topics that it can provide quotes from. Unfortunately the audio interface is rather clumsy and not well thought through. This leads to irritating sequences like:Alexa: "Please say 'yes' or 'no'.Me: YesAlexa: "Yes is not a valid input at this point".Usefulness: 2 out of 5. Although the breadth of quotes is impressive, number wise, it suffers in execution. It is hard to be inspiring in the halting unnatural speech that you get when Alexa reads untailored prose. Quotes are like poetry. To fully get their meaning across, they need pauses at the right points. No editing has been done of these. Someone just took them off the internet, and has Alexa spit them out. In this case quantity does not make up for quality.Novelty: 3 out of 5. I'm really tired of "inspiration quote" skill. Really tired of them. But I have to give kudos to Mike Waldrop for having a topic based one. I've often thought if I ever do a fortune cookie skill that I'd do a multi-plexed mash-up skill. And this is probably would it would look like. Well, maybe with a smoother interface.Overall: 3 out of 5. This has grand ambitions, and could have been really good. But the interface and diction bring it down to mid level.

title: Amazing truth in an age of #fakenews
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
content: This skill truly opened my eyes for the first time.  After years of wearing peacoats, mopping any deck I saw, and eating subs because it sound Navy-ish, I realized just how insignificant the Navy really is.  As an Uber driver, I even had my riders call me "skipper" and rang my own bell when I entered the car...  Did you know there are no Airborne Rangers in the Navy?  They just sit around on boats doing God knows what with goats...!  MIND BLOWN! Go Army!  Beat Navy!

We've seen our share of bad Presidents in the recent past, but to actually describe this as illogical and incoherent but hillarious is disrespectful and bad business. For those who chose to write a review bashing the POTUS, IMO, your review should be deleted. You were asked to review, not spew. What Amazon has done here is to show its card, and this household will no longer be using ANY products be it shopping, Firesticks and yes Alexa. Shame on you Amazon. And shame on those who disrespect President Trump and mock the millions who voted for him and will again. Had this skill been made during the last administration, it wouldnt of made it off the ground. It would have been bashed and cried about and shut down because the left has zero tolerance. O himself would have run Amazon right over the IRS coals. And you really shouldnt have to give a star at all if you're totally unhappy with this skill.

title: An uplifting fortune cookie skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2015
content: Ease of Use: 2 out of 5. It's just a fortune cookie, no real design here. The quote doesn't even come up on the card. This would have been helpful for the ones that went by too quickly.Usefulness: 3 out of 5. If you are looking for inspiration, sure, go for it. This one is more "out there". I don't know where the text comes from, but it doesn't seem as much thought went into it as, say, Focus Word.Novelty: 2 out of 5. Nothing really new here. I do like the "Oh my queen" prefix. It gives it a bit more personality.Overall: 2 out of 5. Another trivially developed fortune cookie skill. A few giggles, but not something I'll leave enabled.

title: Thoroughly Enjoyable
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
content: I have been a long time fan of Jack Benny.  I've often wished I could have the entire collection of his radio shows, but for many reasons that never happened.This is one of the best collections I've encountered not only of Benny, but Phil Harris/Alice Faye, Dennis Day, Mr. Kitzel and many others.  It has been a joy to drop in from time to time (or in my case a long time at a time) and enjoy great shows.The overall quality is quite good.  There are a few issues with sound quality, but thankfully that is the rare occasion.If you enjoy good comedy, this is a definite plus for your list.

title: Does not Provide that much

content: I enabled this skill for something light and airy to listen to before I went to sleep. The free version of the application only gives you 4 stories. That is it - just 4 - period!Just a touch stingy in my humble opinion. The 4 stories provided were entertaining. For a free app that wished me to purchase an upgrade, I would have thought they would have enough stories for a month so I was hooked enough to want to pay. After 4 nights, no way, no how will I pay any money to obtain a version which then might ask me to pay more. I feel deceived.

title: Endless glitching
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
content: This skill repeatedly glitches. It will say a story is starting and then just turn off. Or it will incessently repeat that a story is about to start without it ever actually starting. It won‚Äôt start a new story after the previous one has ended. This is a disaster for my daughter who is fed up with the endless glitching

title: Almost never works...very frustrating
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
content: It's a great concept, but I would say only works about 10% of the time. It will have you pick a favorite subject or ask if you want to spin the wheel. No matter what you choose, it always responds, so you know it understood. Then it's as if it seems to think it's telling the story, but there is dead silence. We have 3 echo dots, one in each kids room. We pay the premium to have access from multiple devices. But even if only one kid is opening story time, it almost never works. It's very frustrating and I wish Amazon would fix this.

content: Save your time and patience on this it‚Äôs the worse. This app crashed 2 times since I‚Äôm writing a bad review so I had to copy paste and send so these crooks would let it fly. The worse thing I ever did was buy this Alexa trash. Siri is a million times better and less stressful not perfect but way better then Alexa who seems she got dropped on her head way to many times. I wish I could do it all over again and never even get this super faulty item with the worse skills. The fact their called skills and the fact you have to activate trash skills to even connect is ridiculous when the others do ut seemlessly. Honestly if I didnt spend over 1k I would toss it all out do to the aggrevation and Alexa being so dimwitted and never answering questions correctly. Honestly instead of making life easier it causes more stress and you have to repeat yourself multile times even when you‚Äôre in the same room. Not defected just trash because I have the Show and Dot along with the premium hub and its all trash and a waste after trying to make a smarthome well you get what you pay for since I wanted to cheap out this is what I get. Should‚Äôve stuck with Apple.

title: Turn your frown upside down! Or, at least, into a smirk.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2017
content: You know, I wake up, bleary eyed, not really wanting to face the day. To put off the pain of a new day or the usual mindless tedium I growl out "Alexa, Flash Briefing" and distract myself long enough to be late for work. All that has ended since I added CompliBot to my Flash Briefing. Just when I think the world is worth giving up on, and I should just live for my dreams, Alexa, via CompliBot, says something nice to me.I won't say it makes my life of manure pies all sunshine and roses, but it is certainly better than a poke in the eye with a plastic daff. So give it a go. Add it to your briefing. Takes a few second to do, takes a few seconds to hear. I'm not going to say it's going to change your life, but it certainly won't make it any worse, so why not?

title: Good Start to the Day
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2017

title: Novelty applause tracks, from enthusiastic to anemic.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2016
content: I have a bunch of novelty apps on my cell phone (the whip and sad trombone being among the best), so why not on my Fire TV.This is a fun Alexa Skill.  Alexa does not speak in this Skill.  I distinguished 4 different applause tracks (there might be more, but I could only clearly distinguish 4).  One was enthusiastic clapping as if from an auditorium full of people.  One was a small group of people (maybe 7-8) clapping and included a few voices saying "yay".  The third sounded like 5-6 people clapping.  The fourth sounded like 3-4 people clapping without much enthusiasm.  The tracks play randomly; you can't select.The really positive thing about this app is that it can be invoked by just saying into the Voice Remote "my applause".  If you don't properly enunciate "my applause", Fire TV might direct you to select from "my Flaws", "my Outlaws", or "my Claus".In summary, I like the ease and words used to invoke the app.  I think the applause tracks could be more robust, because if you're gonna manufacture your own applause you might as well go big.

title: Hamburgergate, pizzagate
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2017
content: Yes, Daniel is a real person! He resides on the Dudley and Bob with Matt morning radio show on 93.7 KLBJ-FM (NOT klbj-AM), week days 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. CST. Daniel is very smart but in a awkward weird way.  He often makes preposterous claims and to the chagrin to the show hosts he is often right! Somehow. You've got to hear him to believe it.We moved to Portland OR from Austin 3 years ago after living there for 7 years and this radio show is the only thing I miss about Texas ! So, I listen to it everyday as a free podcast. Just search for Dudley Bob and Matt show on your favorite player. I CANNOT live without this show!I also listen to the podcasts "The Sideshow with Dudley Bob and Matt" and "Rational Radio with Dale Dudley" too. Obsessive I know, but they get me through my work day.  "Suck or Run" !  "Jet pack out"!

title: Skill Developer Didn't Check for Bugs or Out of Date
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
content: This skill had potential to be really funny and useful, but it doesn't work the way it's advertised. I really wanted to give it 2 stars because it's only meant to be a simple skill to make friends and family laugh, but the syntax is all wrong. You have to ask, "Alexa, open poor", which isn't really as funny as, "Alexa, who is poor". And when you say the latter, Alexa instead of opening the skill, tells you about Henry Varnum Poor, the architect, which is annoying. Also, the developer listed "who is" as a prompt, which also does not work. Perhaps this skill was functioning when it was first made, but became obsolete, as Alexa became smarter and for example, started looking up things like "Henry Poor" to reply to casual questions. Seems that the Alexa AI itself is sometimes at odds with open/free Skill development, because as she gets smarter and replies to all sorts of stuff, a developer has to make their skill more lame by making the prompt something that won't confuse the AI, like "Alexa use "__clunky name of skill here__" to tell me "__the thing you want to know__" which doesn't sound as fun in social settings and is harder to remember when using Skills off the cuff as well. Womp Womp. Bottom line: fix the syntax, so that it works as described in advertisement (or update the Skill advertised info).

title: Read about this skill before using
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
content: Being that our Echo offered this skill to me and I had zero knowledge of this prior to that experience, I think it's important this skill be removed from being used. A lot of users may not continue to agree that the negative notions are a joke. Even with that disclaimer, the insult humor is awful. With many having mental health issues and people being bullied, I think it's necessary to remove this skill from being used. This could severely damage someone's self esteem or push someone over the edge that's on the brink. More thought should be put into the skills you offer and this should not be a monetized skill. Amazon makes enough money as it is.

title: Love Dolly - HATE this APP!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
content: As mentioned in other reviews, this APP is permanent once you get it, NO WAY TO DELETE IT! APP attaches permanently to your account as a "Personal Skill" or Blueprint. Disabling does nothing, just sits there. Seems this is a security issue and (I don't authorized continual use of my account) information issue. Seriously guys?As stated previously..."This has been reported many times for a few months and still no resolution from Alexa developers. The skill codes are not vetted or reviewed for security and privacy. Alexa has a HUGE problem with these rogue skills."You need to do better for you customer/client security. Shame on you!

title: Do not add this skill!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
content: First, the Alexa App promotes this skill. Once added, it isn't as promised. Then, when you disable, the app attaches permanently to your account as a "Personal Skill" or Blueprint. No way to make it go away. Now, it doesn't give an option to Enable or Disable, but says Launch. This is a personal a security issue and not a trusted skill.This has been reported many times for a few months and still no resolution from Alexa developers. The skill codes are not vetted or reviewed for security and privacy. Alexa has a HUGE problem with these rogue skills.

title: So. Hear me out....

A few hours later I tried the ghost detector and it said there was a "Level 2 calm" ghost right behind me. She immediately popped into my head again and since I was still learning about the game I asked Alexa to detect the ghost again but she said "ghost detector's going wild" and I tried the command again and I FOOL YOU NOT Alexa completely ignored my ghost detector command and starts telling me THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN AN ANTONYM. AND A SYNONYM. WHAT. The guy who said Bezos is capturing real dead people might be on to something, yo. But don't worry ya'll, Ms. Gamble didn't get captured, I would never. Godspeed, ghost hunters. Quija board accompaniment not recommended.
